page.title: 01LANGTOFT GAZETTE
page.content: Langtoft is a very old village.It is 2.4 miles north of Market Deeping along the A15.Langtoft runs East-West over the A15 so it is split into two sections known as East End and West End.Both East and West Ends have new,small housing estates.In the East End there is a big playing field which has a football pitch and swings ect. for the smaller children.There is a church,it is called St.Michael's And All Angels.It was built in the 1200s.Just past the crossroads on the West End there is a Butcher's shop,post office,hairdressers and the village shop.A bit further up the village there is the village hall.On the big field beside the new housing estate in Manor Way a new school is in process of being built to replace the old school,built in 1859.It is due to be finished in the summer of 1986.
